page.title: 09BICKNACRE CEMETARY
page.content:
CEMETARY - BICKNACRE
The cemetary lies approximately 250 metres north of the leprosy hospital{ {Hospital & Homes of St. Giles.}The cemetary is small and is entered by passing under a porch. Once inside you see a statue of Jesus in front of an old chapel where funerals used to be held (this is no longer in use). The cemetary is divided into two parts; one part is for the 38 lepers who have died, and the other part is for the 31 nuns who looked after them. Behind each grave is a small cross made of stone. There are 9 leprosy patients left in the hospital; the oldest patient is 89 and one person has been there for 30 years. Leprosy is a very rare disease in Britain, but it is still common in third world countries.
